summary: Unregistered local activities should cause workflow task failure in Ruby SDK. This is a bug where the SDK is not properly validating and failing when an unregistered local activity is invoked.
userImpact: Users can unknowingly execute unregistered local activities without getting proper failure feedback, leading to silent errors and incorrect workflow behavior.
rootCause: Ruby SDK is not validating that local activities are registered before execution and failing the workflow task when they are not.
resolutionDetails: Workflow task now properly fails when attempting to execute an unregistered local activity.
keyQuote: Unregistered Local Activity should fail Workflow Task
